definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: It is the collapsing of the Expander that triggers the Adorer clean up code.
sentences.chinese: 这是崩溃的膨胀触发崇拜者清理代码。

sentences.english: She was a devoted admirer of "The Dream Journey.
sentences.chinese: 她是《梦幻之旅》忠实的崇拜者。

sentences.english: She had read my work, she said; she was an admirer.
sentences.chinese: 她说她读过我的文章，是我的崇拜者。

sentences.english: He was a worshipper of the formless God.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个无形之神的崇拜者。

sentences.english: The gold market needs to make its admirers feel like losers.
sentences.chinese: 金市需要使其崇拜者时常有失败者的感觉。

sentences.english: I thought that was a bit mean." He thinks it's possible that Yoko Ono was an admirer of his.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得大野洋子可能是他的崇拜者。

sentences.english: Cora worshippers painter Arthur but suicide in the home.
sentences.chinese: 科拉的崇拜者画家亚瑟却在家中自杀身亡。

sentences.english: The Modernist admirers of Katsura have always decried the New Shoin.
sentences.chinese: 在现代主义崇拜者桂一直谴责新松阴。

sentences.english: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans.
sentences.chinese: 瓦伦蒂诺几乎被众多的女性崇拜者奉若神明。

sentences.english: These archetypes of the divine are worshipped by Wiccans to this very day.
sentences.chinese: 巫术崇拜者每天崇拜这些神的原型。

sentences.english: Konstantin Shepin is one such admirer.
sentences.chinese: 康斯坦丁就是这样的一个崇拜者。

sentences.english: Some Wiccans see their inspiration and traditions as coming directly from the gods.
sentences.chinese: 一些巫术崇拜者明白他们的灵感和传统直接来自上帝。

sentences.english: Even some of Hammershoi's admirers wonder what it all means.
sentences.chinese: 有些作品甚至连哈默休伊的崇拜者们都不明含义。

sentences.english: The last bull market in gold tested its admirers too.
sentences.chinese: 上一轮黄金牛市也曾对其崇拜者进行过考验。

sentences.english: And cursed are the worshippers of the nazarene.
sentences.chinese: 并诅咒都是拿撒勒的崇拜者。

sentences.english: He always keeps a pen handy for signing for his fans.
sentences.chinese: 为了给他的崇拜者签字，他总是随身带着笔。

definition: to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
